text: Hey! Anyone know what feature specifically within HubSpot (blogs) causes a cookie to be generated for <https://platform.twitter.com> ?
If I had to guess, social sharing and/or built-in opengraph markup generated by the platform

yeah... but working on a site where none of that is in play. Auto-publishing, social sharing, none of it's in use. There were a couple Twitter accounts that were connected, but nothing setup to actually use it. Disconnected and the cookie went away. Seems odd that anything would be loaded tied to a feature that isn't active.
Just trying to sort out managing 3rd party cookies... and a couple cookies like this are not needed so need to get rid of.

<@U0397BZRK6G> I’m not certain if this is the cause but, I would verify if you have the social sharing buttons enabled in blog settings.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/blog/manage-your-blog-template-and-settings#edit-your-social-sharing-settings>
Thanks for the input guys! Gonna do some further testing around this.

Hi there! Does anyone know how to remove a coded color from a form button on a HubSpot landing page/website page? I have a pink border around my Form Submission button. I've been told I need to remove that line of code from the template within the design manager. But I have no clue how to do this!
Hello! Is your template part of a theme? It could be coming from styling in your overall theme.

Hi there! Anyone here know what's the reason why we are no longer allowed to create associated records on the fly on the custom object's right sidebar?

NOTE: This only applies for custom objects but if my memory serves me right, we can do this before regardless of the object type.
just at Elon, he’ll fix it <@U0397BZRK6G>
Hey <@U3T21PDBK>! Good idea. I'll shoot him a text really quick.... :)

Forms question...

• I make changes to a form, like updating GDPR options. Top corner shows "saved with unpublished changes". I do NOT hit "Update".
• I open a page that uses the form to edit the page. The form populates with the unpublished changes.
• I click Update on the web page and it takes my unpublished form changes live with the updated page.
Can't say I've run into this before, but is this how it's supposed to function? Seems more like a bug to me.
